p: Plasmodium falciparum causes the deadliest form of malaria, which impacts over 200 million individuals and results in nearly 450,000 deaths each year, 60% of which are children aged under 5Â years [ 1]. It belongs to the large Apicomplexa phylum of diverse eukaryotic intracellular parasites. In addition to malaria, this phylum also encompasses infectious agents of cryptosporidiosis and toxoplasmosis [ 2]. The latter is caused by Toxoplasma gondii, which is estimated to infect over 30% of the world population, and hence considered as one of the most successful parasites [ 3]. These diseases are not only life-threatening but also widespread and, therefore, represent a serious threat to public health.
